lead_paragraph: The proposal, which Mr. de Blasio plans to present in his State of the City speech, calls for a 16-mile rail line that can flow with automobile traffic and be installed on city streets.

headline.print_headline: Mayor Wants a Streetcar Line  to Link Brooklyn and Queens
headline.main: Mayor de Blasio to Propose Streetcar Line Linking Brooklyn and Queens

snippet: The proposal, which Mr. de Blasio plans to present in his State of the City speech, calls for a 16-mile rail line that can flow with automobile traffic and be installed on city streets.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio is expected to unveil, in his State of City speech, plan for streetcar line that would extend along East River from Brooklyn to Queens, project that would be his administration's most ambitious urban engineering effort; project, expected to cost around $2.5 billion, would begin construction in 2019 and would not be completed until at least 2024.
